channel.title: Comments on: Cardinal Koch “Theological Questions and Perspectives in Jewish-Catholic Dialogue.‚Äù
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2011/10/24/cardinal-koch-theological-questions-and-perspectives-in-jewish-catholic-dialogue-%e2%80%9d/#comment-3719">yossi</a>.
Not accurate. I will post later on what went on.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to yossi.

Not accurate. I will post later on what went on.

item.title: By: yossi
item.dc:creator: yossi
item.description: I understand that the Cardinal's comments on the Cross and Yom Kippur did not go over too well. Also, his suggestion that Jews do not oppose the sainthood for Pius XII is not exactly accurate, is it?
item.content:encoded: I understand that the Cardinal’s comments on the Cross and Yom Kippur did not go over too well. Also, his suggestion that Jews do not oppose the sainthood for Pius XII is not exactly accurate, is it?

item.title: By: Anonymous in Teaneck
item.dc:creator: Anonymous in Teaneck
item.description: At least this is open to the public - his visit to JTS is open to invited guests only: <a href="http://jtsa.edu/News/Press_Releases/JTS_Welcomes_His_Eminence_Kurt_Cardinal_Koch_to_New_York_on_October_31.xml" rel="nofollow">JTS press release</a>
item.content:encoded: At least this is open to the public – his visit to JTS is open to invited guests only: JTS press release
